title_narrative: Strengthened capacity of Jamaica's labour inspectorate to ensure workplace compliance, including OSH and for improved detection and monitoring of child labour
sector_narrative: 16.6 Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels

8.7 Take immediate and effective measures to eradicate forced labour, end modern slavery and human trafficking and secure the prohibition and elimination of the worst forms of child labour, including recruitment and use of child soldiers, and by 2025 end child labour in all its forms
8.8 Protect labour rights and promote safe and secure working environments for all workers, including migrant workers, in particular women migrants, and those in precarious employment
Output 1.4. Increased capacity of constituents, partners and stakeholders to respect, promote and realize fundamental principles and rights at work
description_narrative:
In this biennium, the ILO will support Jamaica's Ministry of Labour and Social Security (MLSS) in improving and implementing its national strategy to prevent and eradicate child labour. Jamaica's draft Country Acceleration Plan (CAP) aims to align with the Regional operational Programme on Child Labour (PRAETI) and SDG Target 8.7 by 2025. Jamaica, the only Caribbean country to implement the ILO's Child Labour Risk Identification Model (CLRISK), has requested ILO support to expand educational engagements into mid-level risk zones and to update the CLRISK model to incorporate pandemic effects and gender perspectives. Requests have also been made for digital transformation support for better data collection and analysis, evidence-based decision-making, and collaboration with key child protection partners for multi-stakeholder education and interventions.

The ILO will assist in enhancing labour inspection processes and technical capacities of inspectors, including the use of hand-held tablets and digital compliance forms. The ILO will provide technical expertise, facilitate capacity building,  and promote knowledge exchange through South-South Cooperation and sub-regional platforms. ILO will also support institutional strengthening and formalized cooperation between the MLSS and the Jamaica Household Workers Union (JHWU) including industrial relations training, development of an MoU focused on child labour and freedom of association, and public awareness campaigns. This initiative will benefit children, adolescents, and the broader community by improving child labour prevention and protection measures.
activity_date_narrative: Planned start date of the activity
